Authors:
D. Christine Cargill, Des A Callaghan, Laura Lowe Forrest,
Catherine Reeb
Title:
Fossombronia isaloensis Cargill & D.A.Callaghan, a new
liverwort from sandstone massifs in southern Madagascar
Abstract:
Introduction. Although Madagascar is known for its unique
fauna and vascular flora, the countryÂ’s bryophyte flora in contrast is
understudied and under collected. Arising from a bryophyte collecting
expedition undertaken in May-June 2016, the purpose of this paper is to
describe a new species of simple thalloid liverwort, Fossombronia
isaloensis, from Madagascar. Methods. Morphological traits across
specimens were reviewed and compared with related species. DNA sequence
data from rbcL, rps4 and trnL-trnF was obtained from 7 accessions of
Fossombronia from Madagascar and 18 other named species of the genus and
used to produce a plastid-based phylogeny. Results and Conclusions. DNA
sequence data show that Fossombronia isaloensis is not closely related
to any other Fossombronia taxon sampled for this study. A description
and diagnosis is provided and a type specimen designated for the new
species. The bryophyte flora of Madagascar urgently deserves further
inventory and taxonomic investigation.
